thanks.. can you tell me basically why you'd want a different subnet within a lan?
a subnet mask of 255.255.255.0 with a network of 192.168.0.0 covers 192.168.0.0 through 192.168.0.255
a subnet mask of 255.255.255.0 is equivalent to 192.168.0.* while 255.255.0.0 is 192.168.*.*
another way to notate it is using CIDR
so with the second subnet mask I could effectively do an address range of 192.168.1.1-255 ?
